scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle. [Monica] then expressed concern about setting a precedent. You agreed with her point and mentioned that perhaps you should have communicated your limits better.
scenes.description: [Bob] smirks and says, 'Well, [Alex], if you keep helping out like that, you might as well never take a leave. Don’t you think it just shows how indispensable you are?'

options.text: Maybe, but I think it’s important to strike a balance. Everyone needs time off.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the importance of balance, showing strong emotional perception and empathy, but moderate motivation.

options.text: I see your point, Bob. It’s definitely something I need to work on.
options.analysis: You show understanding and willingness to improve, demonstrating good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: Honestly, if the team needs me that much, maybe they need to step up their game.
options.analysis: You take a more assertive stance, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and social skills.
